figureOfSpeech: Comment ca se plume(lit.: How is it plucking?)
translation: How are you? How are things?

figureOfSpeech: Ca porte les memes calecons.(lit.: They wear the same underpants.)
Quand les poules auront des dents(lit.: When chickens have teeth

translation: A corn or wheat cake fried in deep fat.

figureOfSpeech: Deteler le wagon au milieu du marais(lit.: to unharness the wagon in the middle of the swamp)
translation: To give up in the middle of an undertaking.

figureOfSpeech: Avoir les narines effleurees.(lit.: To have flaring nostrils)
Capotez pas la maison!(lit.: Don't turn the house over!
Les boulangeries se sont battues.(lit.: The bakeries had a fight.)
translation: There is frost on the ground.

figureOfSpeech: Avoir la langue trop longue.(lit.: Tongue is too long.
Avoir tous leur tetes dans le meme bonnet.(lit.: To have all their heads in the same bonnet.)
translation: Of several people to think alike; to be in complete agreement.
